verbose_text: Furthermore, it was revealed that 3 commonly used drugs, levofloxacin, azithromycin and paracetamol, effectively inhibited hepatic indocyanine green (ICG) uptake and induced higher expression levels of hepatotoxicity associated genes compared with that of the animals treated with these drugs in vivo, suggesting that the LMTC model may be more sensitive in detecting and predicting drug associated hepatotoxicity.
evidence: azithromycin and paracetamol, effectively inhibited hepatic indocyanine green
